Reviews.Title: PIP and Samsung service and a registration recommendation
Reviews.Author: Namaste "Rich"
Reviews.Content: I love my new Samsung PN51E6500 51-Inch 3D Plasma Smart HDTV!To avoid redundancy I will leave the main feature reviews to the other reviewers and try to cover some other possibly useful areas.It was extremely difficult for me to find out information about PIP when these first came out, so for anyone who is wondering, it DOES have picture in picture (PIP).  It is hidden under the System menu.  It is not split screen (disappointing!), where the two windows are equal size, and it is a single tuner, so you cannot easily watch two broadcast sources, but you can have (for instance) an exercise DVD playing in one window while someone else watches the news or a soap opera or a Football game.  Of course you can only hear the sound from one input at a time. I haven't tried using the antenna as an input or using the extra features of a Blu-Ray player as input, but I imagine there are other ways to finagle the inputs.I highly recommend registering your HDTV at the Samsung site, as they give you an extra 3 months of warranty for doing so.  If you think that is not significant, let me tell you MY story.  I had a 2010 Samsung PN50C680G5FXZA that I had purchased around Christmas of 2010. It started having problems with the power supply in January of 2012, which normally would have been out of warranty, but I had luckily registered the TV and received the extra 3 months of coverage!  Samsung first sent a repairman out to attempt to fix the problem.  He replaced a circuit board, but the problem persisted.  He then ordered more parts, but apparently Samsung has a policy that your repair should be completed within a certain period of time, so I called support and they preceded to investigate a refund or exchange.  I did bounce around a bit between the support staff, but with a little persistence, I was able to get an exchange for the 2012 model with equivalent (or better) features (They didn't have any 2011 models in stock.)  This is the HDTV I am reviewing.Needless to say, I am VERY happy with the end result of my Samsung support experience.Please don't forget to register for the extra three months of warranty coverage!!!I am a sole caregiver for my wife, who has Early Onset Alzheimer's and don't have time to write many reviews, so if you feel this one has been helpful, PLEASE consider voting for this review.Thank you,

Reviews.Title: It is about the whole package.
Reviews.Author: mclix
Reviews.Content: I spent months debating about this set, and the Panasonic ST50, driving myself utterly insane, and roaming several AV focused sites, such as HDTVtest, AVS, and AV. When not researching online, I would go out to several stores and demo the respective units myself. It was a long process, and in the end I pulled the trigger on this particular set. Yes, the Panasonic has the better black levels. That is the truth. However, only slightly. Some people may care about that slight improvement, some people may not. To me, personally, it was not enough. I needed an overall value that the Panasonic could not offer.The e6500 offers better input lag, motion handling, better output of non optimal HD sources such as from a cable provider or streaming applications, a better anti reflective filter, and bette color reproduction. Another selling point to me was also what most professional AV sites have observed: excellent resistance to Image retention. I have observed none. This is indeed a beautiful set. The picture quality is amazing, the Smart TV features are robust, and of course, the 60 inch size truly makes for an immersive experience. Even the design of the set itself is gorgeous with classy looks. The AR filter works great, and the set gets plenty bright with no visable reflections that can be a bane to plasma. What I will say is this - invest in a home theater system, or a home theater in a box, or even a sound bar. Why? The speakers are not very good. The sound output is too low, with not enough depth. I have to pump the volume up for this set. Besides, if you are investing in a 60 inch tv, might as well invest a decent sound system for it in my opinion.I just was not able to put up with the some of the issues plaguing the Panasonic model, which is excellent by the way. Issues such as stubborn image retention, vertical bands, and dirty screen effects. Not every one will experience those issues, as it seems to be a panel lottery, but I have read enough complaints about them in the past year to make me rethink my original choice. I also witnessed some of these issues in store, but not on the Samsung.Speaking of a lottery, yes it is true that some people may get a "buzzer". Some people get a loud one, some a faint one, and some none at all. I am happy to say that mine has no buzz at all. If you do get a "buzzer", Amazon has a great return and exchange policy. Just swap it out. Luckily, I will not have to do that.Again, the Samsung and Panasonic are both terrific sets. One cannot go wrong. It is a question of what you can live with and what you can live without. This is just one customers recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with major flaw
Reviews.Author: PatBoersma
Reviews.Content: This TV has amazing picture quality, deep blacks and is bright enough to watch during the day without having to block out the windows. However, during any bright scenes it emits an electronic buzz. This buzzing becomes incredibly loud while watching 3D content, audible even over fairly loud volumes. The 3D also has very noticeable crosstalk with high contrast areas, white text on a black background is nearly unreadable in 3D. The TV itself is beautiful, but I can't believe Samsung would release the new 2012 models without fixing the buzzing sound that plagued the 2011 models.

Reviews.Title: Loving this TV
Reviews.Author: Ryo
Reviews.Content: I was originally going to get the PN60E550, but then I read that the 6500 had an anti-glare coat while the other did not. I'm VERY glad that I decided to spend a couple hundred extra dollars. There is barely any reflection on this screen and even if there is, it's faint and you can only see it when the screen is completely black. Picture quality is better than I expected, especially after calibrating the set. I had heard that the speakers were bad, so I paired this with the Sony HT-CT150 and I couldn't be happier. Perfect for my apartment. Blu-Ray looks AMAZING, and the 3D is really good. Streaming Netflix on the PS3 with X-High quality looks as close to Blu-Ray as you can possibly get without having the disc. I don't have the buzzing problem so many people complain about with Samsung Plasmas, although I can hear a faint buzzing if the TV is on with no sound and I'm standing right in front of it (directly in the center. can't hear it if I'm standing to the side which is odd). If you were going to get the 550, spend the extra money. It's worth itI'd also like to add that I don't know why Amazon says the 6500 doesn't have a swivel stand. The stand allows me to turn my TV left and right

Reviews.Title: 60" PN60E6500
Reviews.Author: KN
Reviews.Content: I will not critique the picture quality, as I will leave that to the experts. Note that I am very pleased with the TV and the picture quality surpasses my previous 55" LED.Buzzing Sound: There  is a buzzing soun,d however I can only hear it while standing directly in front of the TV. The sound will disappear after stepping slightly off center.Brightness pops: I've spent countless hours researching TVs and noticed this issue with several plasmas. This is my second day of use and I have not encountered any brightness pops.2D-3D function:My family and I watched Harry Potter and the deathly hallows part 2, and was very pleased with the 2D-3D conversion.Overall, I am very pleased with features, picture quality, and design.If there are specific questions, feel free to ask in the comments.

Reviews.Title: Worth Every Penny! Even great in my Bright Room
Reviews.Author: Weis23
Reviews.Content: After having great luck with a Samsung LCD I choose the Samsung E6500 over the Panny ST50.  The primary reason I did was the CNET review that claims a slightly better picture in bright rooms. I have two windows to the side of the Samsung and I still get a great picture without "distracting" reflections during the day.  There are reflections, but I am not distracted by them when watching TV.  With the CNET settings I have found that the picture during the day is bright enough to comfortably watch content.  The Samsung is not as bright as a LCD or LED, but I find it to be plenty bright. As for features other than the great picture, I found connecting to my wifi to be a snap.  The TV connected immediately, updated the TV's firmware and apps and within minutes I was watching Youtube videos.  Although 3D is an afterthought for me, I found that the E6500 does a good job with it.  I was impressed with the little content I have watched so far. As far as the buzzing issues others have written about, I have not experienced any buzzing whatsoever. For what it's worth I did not use break-in slides for the first 150 hours of use and my son played Wii on my E6500 from day one. No burn-in issues so far, or anything that resembles burn-in.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Buzzing Noise and Screen Uniformity Issues
Reviews.Author: Bears Fan 1963
Reviews.Content: Returned three PN60E6500's because all of them buzzed like an defective fluorescent light - unbearable high pitched noise that could be heard 15 ft away.  Moreover, on a white background ( e.g snow, ice, or hockey game) the screen could not produce a uniform white color, there is a faint but noticeable magenta hue on white backgrounds in areas throughout the panel. During motion or panning left or right the panel exhibited what is known as 'dirty screen effect', it appears as if someone has taken their dirty hands and wiped them across the inner panel.I naively ignored other consumer complaints about Samsung plasma's buzzing and had to learn the hard way. One would think after four years of consumers complaining about Samsung Plasma TVs buzzing they would fix it by now. That being said, its also very disappointing and indicative of the quality of Samsung Plasma TV's when after three returns, not one TV had a clean and uniform screen. A White background should be white, not tints of red. There should not be hot spots where areas of the screen are brighter. The inner panel glass should be clean and smug free after applying the anti-reflective coat.Avoid this TV and Samsung TVs until they address these flaws, many of which have been reoccurring since 2008 ( i.e. buzzing noise).

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: sambel
Reviews.Content: This is truly an excellent TV.  I've owned several HDTV's including the vaunted Pioneer Kuro KRP-500m.  This Samsung is by far my favorite.  The picture quality is fantastic.  I've been watching the Movie preset with no further adjustments.  Color is perfect.  Images are clean and sharp (but not overly sharp).  It makes other TV's I've owned look blurry.  Blacks are good, not great.  Regardless, I can't say enough about how good the picture is.  The design is top notch.  The brushed bezel and black stand look high end.  I briefly owned the E550 plasma and this one looks significantly nicer.  I have the TV in a very bright room.  Glare was a nightmare with the E550, but isn't a problem with the E6500.  Online services work well.  I downloaded the 3D demo app.  3D is very impressive, although mostly a gimmick as far as I'm concerned.  A quick note about buzz, yes this TV buzzes although not enough to be a problem.  I can't hear it at normal volume levels.  For comparison, the Kuro I owned drove me crazy because it was so loud.  I imagine room acoustics play a big part in how bad the problem is.  Maybe I'm just lucky, but I consider it a non-issue with this set.  Overall, I'm thrilled with this TV.  It's the 8th HDTV I've owned and it's definitely the best of the bunch (and that includes the Kuro).  Picture quality is virtually identical to the flagship E8000 for considerably less money.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Griswald37
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv as a replacement to my Toshiba 50" DLP television. When the television was delivered to my house it took me literally 5 minutes to put together the stand, hook up the HDMI cables and turn it on.After the television was turned I activated the Wifi features, did the update, and was watching television. So all in all it took me 10 minutes to get my tv up and running.I watched so many different things after I had all the hook ups and update completed me and my wife were truely amazed by the clarity, colors, and easy hook up. After we finished surfing channels, we watched a 3D movie. The 3D on this is truely amazing, we said, "It's better than the movie theater".After I the research I did for plasma vs lcd vs led, I am glad I went plasma. So for all that read this, this tv has everything that a family could want in a tv.I see that people are posting things about a buzzing sound.  I have not heard this buzzing and the sound is amazing.  The sound is so amazing, I can turn the volume to 15 - 20 and it's too loud.After a month, I post an update. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, but has issues.
Reviews.Author: theshutteraddict
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the picture quality. Yes, I do have a slight buzz, but it doesn't bother me and I can't hear it over the normal volume of the sound system.However, I have some other issues which made me want to return it. Great amazon return service by the way, customer service is excellent as always.The issues I have are.1. HTPC connectivity via DVI - if you use a PC input and if it is anything other than HDMI output , then you have to set the pixel format to RGB, which, in this case, if your black level's are set to anything other than "standard" in the menu (mine was set to "low") the brightness of the TV increases automatically after a few minutes of watching TV and looks a bit washed out. This is fixed by setting it to "standard" and reducing your brightness to compensate for not being able use the "low" setting. Or by setting the pixel format to YCbCr on the video card if you have HDMI output.2. Distortion/Flicker on 1080p (this is a major issue/headache) - For some reason if I set my XBOX 360 or Panasonic BluRay player to 1080p , I get horizontal flickering lines towards to the right side of the screen , sometimes they pop-up towards the middle of the screen too. If I set the devices to 1080i, this issue goes away. I have changed power cords, used more expensive HDMI category 2 (high speed) cables, plugged only once device in at a time, but this still happens. I am going to talking more with Samsung tech support on this, as I need this resolved or a reason why this happens, since I plan to replace this TV with the same model exchange from Amazon if it can be narrowed down that it is a defect with this particular unitUpdate 12/29/2012 - updated from 3 starts to 4.The TV was replaced by Amazon. The second issue of the flickering screen or static lines appearing randomly on the screen for bluray and Xbox 360 @ 1080p (note, this doesn't happen if you set input type to PC) is now gone with the replacement TV. I actually returned the old one, planning to buy a different model thinking this is a model wide issue, but after doing ton of research, I couldn't find enough complaints to warrant this is a model wide issue, so I bought the same identical model 60" again, and for my luck it was $100 cheaper on thanksgiving week. I just couldn't find a comparable model that had the same reviews of picture quality, features, and subtle but great looks. I am happy with the choice I made, the new TV doesn't seem to have any issues I can see, but I will run it a month or so and report back. I do have the slight buzzing, but again, that's just how plasma TVs work, and I can't hear it any louder than my refrigerator in my small apartment. I got no issue with that. I would give this five stars for picture quality, but I had to give 4 overall due to my opinion that Samsung is ruining a great TV with less than adequate quality control, and letting defective ones get out. These are big items, huge in size, it costs buyers time, even when shipping is free, to wait at home for these guys to come pick it up, pack it again, return, etc.

Reviews.Title: Some hear the buzz, some don't.  If you do, it's bad.
Reviews.Author: L. Burns
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this TV.  Almost.  I'm giving it two stars because although it seemed wonderful in most ways, we had to return it.We read about the buzz that some people experienced, but we thought we'd see if we got one that didn't.  I suspect, though, that they all buzz- people just vary in whether they can hear it.  I couldn't, really, and I would have been perfectly happy - but it drove my husband crazy.  It reminded him of the sound of old CRT computer monitors, especially early color ones, which had a high-pitched whine.  He said his ears were ringing for hours after watching a football game.  We used the TV every day for a week - it didn't get better.So we exchanged it for the Panasonic: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00752VKBY/ref=ox_ya_os_product.  So far so good on that - those who do hear the buzz will do better with this one, it seems.A couple differences between the two:  there doesn't seem to be any keyboard readily available to use with the browser in the Samsung, which really limits its utility.  The Panasonic, it appears, works with Bluetooth keyboards that are available - but we haven't tried it yet.  The Panasonic also comes with Amazon Prime viewing, unlike the Samsung, but you can always get a Blu-ray player that has it, if you want Prime streaming on the Samsung.  The Samsung's pedestal pivots, which the Panasonic's doesn't, if that's important to you. The Panasonic sits about an inch lower on its stand than the Samsung does.  The sound on the Samsung is noticeably better.Again - lovely TV.  But we couldn't keep it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for a fairly good price
Reviews.Author: SeanG
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first HDTV after using a really old square box built sometime in the 80s probably. I did a ton of research on Plasma vs. LED/LCD, and really I chose plasma becase the lighting issues weren't that big of a concern, and having 600hz vs 240 was a big leap forward in terms of watching sports and playing video games, the two things I use the tv for the most. I think the TV really has been exceptional as far as picture quality - its really very clear and I think a very unique characteristic is that its glass pane is much less reflective of that of other Plasma tvs, namely the LG PA6500. I bought the LG because it was cheaper, but after viewing the Samsung could really tell the difference and went back to the Samsung even though it had a higher price.I'm very happy with this tv. I rarely use the 3D, but its certainly a feature that's nice to have and though the glasses they provide are cheap and flimsy, they do the job ok.All in all, I think this was one of my better purchases. Also, I got it for a reduced price by buying a used factory one that has a few nicks on it from when people were returning/exchanging it before. Worth that $400 savings.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely stunning
Reviews.Author: Strap
Reviews.Content: Pros:- unbelievable picture clarity and color- very customizable yet very good out of the box- excellent price-to-performance ratio- great connected/internet options for online viewing- deep, inky blacks cannot be praised enoughCons:- very minor reflection (only if the light source is directly in front of the screen)- there is no such thing as too thin- the stand makes it difficult to place a speaker right in front of the tvI bought this tv 5 months ago and it still leaves me as impressed today as it did the very first day. Whenever I'm away and am forced to watch a different tv, I'm even more in awe when I return home. The richness and saturation of the colors and the deep blacks are simply unparalleled. The fact that the price has not only not decreased but has gone up is a testament to how good the tv is. The only thing I would change is the stand and perhaps getting it in a larger size.Regarding the buzz, yes, if I stand close and listen there does appear to be a slight hum, but my dog, who is incredibly sensitive to odd noises, does not seem to even be aware of it. Once the volume is turned up to any degree, the noise, as far a I'm concerned, is a non-factor. Also, I watch this is a room with giant, 15ft windows and the reflection is negligible. If the screen is tilted even a few degrees away from the window/light it completely disappears.

Reviews.Title: Awful Buzzing Sound
Reviews.Author: William Del Genio
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure if my particular TV was defective or worse than other TVs of the same model, but there was a blatant buzzing noise that forced me to return it within 30 mins.  The buzzing noise sounds something like a fluorescent light fixture with a bad ballast.  It was present in all modes that the TV was on and no adjustment of any of the settings made it any better.  I was able to hear the buzz clearly even from my bedroom.  I really regret not paying any heed to the reviews that mentioned the buzzing noise.Other notes:The picture itself is very nice and the TV itself is good, as far as I could tell from using it for under an hour.The stand is very wobbly, make sure you have a solid piece of furniture and solid floor to put it on if you want to use it on a stand.

Reviews.Title: Great experience!
Reviews.Author: Dave Dawson
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews about this television and was surprised at some of the negative comments. My experience was outstanding. It arrived ahead of schedule and I was called a day ahead of delivery to arrange a time. A couple (man and women) delivered the tv at the time promised. They brought it in the house, unpacked it,  and took it to the second floor of the house. They set it up and made sure it was working and connected to the internet. On top of that they took the huge packing box away with them. Plus the tv has a great picture, no dead pixels and no problems whatsoever. I am totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: a review for researchers
Reviews.Author: Joel B. Swartz "joel"
Reviews.Content: As someone who did research for months on end trying to get the right TV I'll write the kind of review I wished was writtenThe TV never made it on the stand went directly on the wall so I can't comment on that. The TV has had no buzz but I live in MD at about 76 miles above sea level and from my understanding this creates most of the issue. The picture is ridiculous. I previously owned a 1080p lcd from sony which always had good picture(especially on blu rays). I won't say it's like an upgrade from standard tv to hd tv but the picture difference between the my old 1080p lcd and this plasma is like going from 720p cable to 1080p bluray. The picture is just awesome. I used the Disney WOW to calibrate and just can't imagine the picture quality going up $100 or so better after professional calibration.  The apps run smooth 9 times out of 10 and the Netflix and Amazon prime pictures look very good. As stated in every other review the Plasmas don't look as great in the day light. The TV isn't reflective but the picture looks a little washed out (still awesome though especially golf for some reason). What I have learned from experience is the TV is only going to be as good as the source. The stuff in standard is noticeably lacking, that may be because the hd stuff has spoiled me but i know some tv's do a better job of making non HD stuff look a little cleaner. Remote is fine, I use the tv speakers for the smart hub stuff and they are fine also. Waited about a day before i started playing Call of Duty, dont really do marathon gaming but no IR after about an hour of gaming or a full Sox game on ESPN with the ticker underneath. The 3d is nice, the Smart Apps has some 3d clips you can look at and its "neat". Tried 3d gaming and gave me horrible headache after about 10 minutes but it was cool.I would def recommend this tv to anyone looking to get their picture up to the next level. I have yet have another guy over who has not commented on how great the picture is, and they all own led or lcd of some type

Reviews.Title: Why must it buzz!?!
Reviews.Author: AofI
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, features, price, picture all exceeded my expectations. But the slight buzz this TV puts out can drive me nuts if I'm sitting in the wrong spot. If you are one of us that can hear higher pitched buzzing then this TV might not be the one for you. We will be keeping it because my g/f can't really hear it and I don't watch much tv, plus I use my projector for movies and gaming.But I would give this TV 5 stars if they fixed this issue.

Reviews.Title: So Far so Good
Reviews.Author: Myself
Reviews.Content: No IR, good blacks, second best class out there.  Same darn thing as the e7000 without a dual core processor for web apps, and the 8000 without the stupid microphone and built in web cam.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Good Price
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: We have had this TV for about a month. My understanding is that this TV has essentially the same picture specs as the 8000 without all the bells and whistles of voice control, etc (which we don't want). This 60 inch TV has an excellent picture and works well. I would consider myself a very particular and demanding consumer. As some other reviews have mentioned there is a low hum or "buzz" that comes from the TV, but at least in our case the 5.1 surround system we have renders the hum unnoticeable.Our only real concern is burn in. Despite many people's claim that burn in worries are a thing of the past, the Samsung instructions and warranty are very explicit in not covering burn in and warning that you must run the TV for more than 100 to 150 hours before attempting to use video games or other things with fixed images on screen for longer than 20 minutes at a time.I will update this review if any burn in related problems are encountered.Barring any burn in issues, at $1599 for a 60 inch TV with an excellent picture I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Sharp picture, but it does buzz
Reviews.Author: curiousgeorge65
Reviews.Content: I gave this TV 4 out of 5 stars because the picture quality was nice and the 3D worked well enough. There was a little bit of double picture during faster action scenes when viewing 3D but it's not a deal breaker. However, what is a deal breaker is the buzzing noise that come from the TV. I read other reviews that said it buzzes and others that said it wasn't much of a problem or didn't buzz at all so I decided to go for it. First day, I noticed the buzzing but tried to ignore it and tell myself, "If I turn the volume up, I won't hear it anyways". I was right. But I don't always want to watch TV with the volume up to drown out the buzzing noise. Now don't get me wrong, the buzzing noise isn't terribly loud, and whats strange is you can't hear when your head is tilted at certain angles, but it's simply just annoying background noise. Almost like constantly white noise in the background.Anyways, if you can put up with it (unlike me), this is a great TV. Sharp picture, nice 3D, cool smart TV features. I just had to return it because of the buzzing.

Reviews.Title: One that we will keep for some time
Reviews.Author: alyster4k
Reviews.Content: Do you want to watch TV on a grand scale? Do you want to be the envy of your friends? Will this TV grow you more chest hair? Perhaps all of these are true. We upgraded from a 56" DLP to this 60" plasma and couldn't be more happier. All the family wants to be at our house for movie night, football games, and watching any kind of web streaming video.It's been nearly a month since we've bought this TV and immediately used the Digital Trends recommended settings after my 13-year old and I unboxed this beast and set it up. It stayed on it's stand for a week and then was finally moved to the wall. It's ultra thin, has a svelte trim piece, limitless viewing angle, and extremely vivid colors coupled with blacks so dark you may wonder if part of the TV is actually turned off. We nary have any blinds / real curtains in our living room or the surrounding kitchen and entryway so glare was actually the biggest concern prior to purchase. We ended up mounting it a foot above couch/sitting level on the wall and tilting it slightly down. That seemed to have done the trick because we don't really notice hardly any glare now. Part of the equation is that it is so bright however.In the box the included 3D glasses worked awesome (the content itself within Smart Hub seemed to buffer often however), the remote is lit and easy to maneuver, and you can set the settings up individually for each input which is cool. The only button on the set is actually the power button on the bottom left of the unit and actually pivots in case you try to use that button for navigating the menu as well, however painful that may be. Don't lose the remote. We did opt for a new URC WR7 remote (URC WR7 Universal Remote Control for up to 7 A/V Components with 4 Favorite Channel Buttons) that handles all of the interactivity besides the Smart Hub work for our cable box, TV, and soundbar.The Samsung Smart Hub is great as well. We downloaded a few apps, hooked up our Netflix and Amazon accounts, and quickly learned that it found our DLNA-compatible network attached storage device on our local network without a hiccup. My 8-year old was navigating family movies and photos within a few minute on our NAS. I was surprised there were as many apps within their store as their was actually. We tried a few games as well so that is a quick fun point to mention. Of note, we didn't use the built-in wireless because we have more bandwidth using our newer 802.11ac router (NETGEAR Wireless Router - AC 1750 Dual Band Gigabit (R6300)) downstairs and bridge (Linksys Wireless-AC Universal Media Connector (WUMC710)) that the TV itself is connected to along with our Xbox 360. We are awaiting our Skype camera (Samsung VG-STC2000 Skype TV Camera (2012 Models)) to use with the television's own Skype app to be delivered this week to plug directly into it's USB port.If you couple this television with a nice mount, some LED backlighting (LED Backlight Kit for 46" to 57" TV LCD Flatscreen (Wall Mount)), and a soundbar with a good sub (Polk Audio SurroundBar IHT 6000 Instant Home Theater (Black)) to cover your lows and you really do have an instant home theatre. This is what we've done. Be sure to buy enough drinks and popcorn because your company will not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture - no buzzing
Reviews.Author: david daiker
Reviews.Content: This TV is just as good as the reviews describe it. I have it in a room full of windows, and the picture is still clear, and bright with very deep color. Have asked everyone who visits whether they can hear a buzz sound as I lower/mute the volume, and so far no one can hear anything at all. So maybe they fixed it. 3D isn't too impressive for kids PSP games, but maybe I was expecting too much.

Reviews.Title: GreatTV
Reviews.Author: B. O. A. Black "airbusmark"
Reviews.Content: Shopped and read review until I was blue in the face! Could have saved time and just believed the CNET and other reviews.[...] This is a great TV and with HD cable looks good, Blue Ray and DVD looks great! Smooth colors, deep blacks, lighting is unbelievable. Samsung is truly building some great Plasma TVs

Reviews.Title: AVOID SAMSUNG PLASMA - BURN_IN AFTER A FEW MONTHS
Reviews.Author: BadApple
Reviews.Content: The good: very good image quality, better than their LED TVs.The bad: After using it for 4 months the screen is already burned, in the areas where the TV displays subtitles.While I understand burn-in or retention from watching CNN tickers, games, fixed logos, etc. this was caused by the TV's own firmware. When watching content from the USB stick or through the network, using srt or similar subtitles, the TV firmware puts them in BRIGHT WHITE at the same location every time. There is no option to make them another color or less bright, to alleviate the problem.The current implementation of subtitles in the 'Not So Smart TVs' could be called 'Plasma Suicide'.Samsung says 'not covered, your tough luck'.The pixel scroll is useless (only 4 pixels is not enough, it just blurs the burned area a bit).The scrolling pattern that should make it better is like refinishing your floors - it will wear out every pixel a bit in hope of making them more similar in intensity (all lower). Didn't work for me and would likely just add wear and tear to the cells if used often.STAY AWAY FROM SAMSUNG PLASMAS. (Unless you get a new one every half year).

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: joseph barnathan
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture deep blacks  great web apps good sound very thin gaming is a very quick response  no complaints

Reviews.Title: Great Overall TV
Reviews.Author: Corey G
Reviews.Content: I am going to make this short and sweet for everyone. I received the TV Friday afternoon. The white glove delivery was good, except only one person came. That is alright because I am a capable person and could help the guy.For the TV itself, out of the box, the picture is so-so. After consumer calibration (via AVS HD 709), the picture is absolutely stunning. I have never had a picture look as nice as the one on this TV (I've owned LED's and LCD's). The blacks are very deep and the white levels are great too.As far as reflections goes, when the TV is off, it basically looks like a mirror. I bought this TV for the real black pro filter, and it does not disappoint. I can watch the TV midday with my sliding doors at the side of the TV wide open.When I first got the TV and was adjusting the settings, I did put it on mute, and I noticed a slight buzzing, but it is not loud at all. My PS3 runs louder than the buzzing does on my TV, that is how little of an issue that is. When I'm watching anything, I don't even notice the buzzing at all.There is a slight lag to the menus, in which upgrading to the dual core e7000 would probably help in that aspect. It was bearable though and it did not take me long to get through all of the assortment of options to optimize the picture on this set.I saw very little cross talk in 3d, almost unnoticeable. I've watched several 3d films so far with my girlfriend. At times, we actually prefer 3d (2d to 3d conversion included) because the image just seems so crisp.I watched the NFL NFC Championship game on it this Sunday, and it was amazing as well.I would definitely recommend this TV to anyone looking for a good Plasma TV.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, but really annoying buzz
Reviews.Author: C. Quinn
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV was fantastic.  I have nothing but great things to say about the color and picture quality.  But if you ever watch TV with the volume realitively low, the buzzing noise this TV makes will drive you insane.  The buzzing sound is very focused and can only be heard directly in front of the TV.  If you move to either side, you can hardly hear it at all... but most of the time I want to sit directly in front.  I called Samsung support and they told me this was normal, and I should just turn the volume up.I should have paid closer attention to the reviews that warned about the buzzing noise.  After a few days my wife and I decided that we couldn't take it anymore.  We returned it and bought the Panasonic TC-p60st50.  The picture quality on the Panasonic is just as good, if not better, than this Samsung and there is no buzz!  I highly recommend the Panasonic.  I give it 5 stars. If you watch TV with the volume loud, then this Samsung could be OK.  Otherwise, get the Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: good tv good 3d
Reviews.Author: mr.perfect
Reviews.Content: just got this tv on the 05/06/12 and so far so good tho there is a couple of things first the sound isn't to great but that is what you get with all these new ultra thin tv! second it has also has an auto light sensor that will change the brightness of the tv depending on the brightness of your room so if you have a lot of windows where your tv is at it will start to change friquently in brightnes but i heard a lot of new tv have this technolgy! Besides the sound and some times annoying light changeing brightness, its a great buy

Reviews.Title: BEST  TV I EVER BOUGHT... ONLY PAID $745 AND DELIVERED FREE AND UNDAMAGED...
Reviews.Author: christian b. lindheimer
Reviews.Content: TV HAS THE EVER SLIGHTEST PLASMA HUMM NOISE; BUT, ALL OTHER  NIOSE IN ROOM HAS TOO BE OFF AND MUTE TOO HEAR JUST A FAINT BUZZING SOUND... MY REFRIGERATOR HUMMS BIG TIME... MY EAR INJURY "EAR TINNITUS" RINGS LOUDER... YOU HAVE TOO PUT YOUR HEAD AND EAR ON THE SCREEN TOO HEAR A FAINT  PLASMA HUMMM... I LIVE IN SMALL APT. AND THE 20WATT OUTPUT IS FINE FOR MY APT.  GET YOURSELF A C2G MODEL #28733 DIGITAL TO ANALOG AUDIO CONVERTER  AND PLUG THE POWER IN AND YOUR RED N WHITE RCA AUDIO JACKS TOO THE FRONT THEN  PLUG IN YOUR HEADPHONES AND THE JUST PLUG THE OTHER END OF THE RED/WHITE RCA CABLE INTO THE BACK OF YOUR CABLEBOX OR BLU-RAY... THE TURN UP THE VOLUME ON THE CONVERTER TOO LISTEN.... YOU STILL HAVE TOO SWITCH THE TV TOO EXTERNAL SPEAKERS TOO TURN OFF TV VOLUME... NOW ENJOY TV WHILE THE REST OF THE HOUSE SLEEPS... THIS TV ROCKS...:)

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: D. lahoz
Reviews.Content: Im a plasma fan. I will only buy plasma. So please take this with a grain of salt.Styling is very nice. Not a huge fan of the leg style stand as far as function goes but no doubt it looks nice. Havent used the 3d so no comment. Havent tried the "smart features" cause I dont really care about those, sorry. TV is super light for a plasma.Broke in the set for 200 hours prior to calibration. Used the CNET settings and so far they are spot on for blu ray watching and PS3 games (Last of Us looks stunning on this set). I bought this set strictly for the picture quality and absolutley no complaints.  What you heard is true, the PQ is as good as it gets if the conditions are right. Please keep this in mind; plasma is not the solution for bright rooms. Its just not. I have this in my living room and I am able to control the light very well in the daytime. Even so, PQ is subdued in the day time. Not bad or annoying but it is not at the awesome level it reaches in the dark. But if you cant control the light go LCD-LED. So many of the negative comments and reviews about plasma are from people who dont realize this or who say the heck with it and buy one anyway. That being said, my roomate has a 60 inch Samsung LCD-LED and he cant beleive the PQ difference between the two. Plasma buzz is there (always is with plasma) but is not noticeable at ANY normal viewing angle (i dont live at elevation though, if you do, do some research).Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Stunning
Reviews.Author: A. Laksana
Reviews.Content: I always thought my LED looked pretty good.  Well, I guess I haven't really seen what a true Great Picture is until I see this TV.  The picture is absolutely stunning, it puts my Sony LED to shame.  The black is inky black and picture uniformity and off-angled quality are absolutely breathtaking.  The only negative is I really regret that I didn't try plasma a lot earlier.  I was gotten into the LED/LCD, who-has-the-thinnest-TV hype.  If you've never considered a plasma before, do me a favor and see this TV, you will not go back to LED ever again.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: I must admit we were a little concerned ordering a television by internet, but we have been extremely pleased.  The TV was delivered in a timely manner with no damage.  It was not difficult for my husband to set up and the quality of the set is great.  Because I have "Prime" with Amazon we got free delivery-a great bonus on such a large item.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Was Looking For!
Reviews.Author: Chris Coughlin
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable plasma TV & I found one in the PN60E6500. While quality 'black levels' were something that I was searching for, I was also interested in a plasma that provided vibrant colors, as well. Without sacrificing much in the 'black level' department, that is exactly what this TV does. I'm very happy with my purchase. While it's not the 'utlra-slim' design provided in the 7000 & 8000 models, it's still rather slim & looks very sleek when mounted on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Simply awesome television
Reviews.Author: Michealj
Reviews.Content: I haven't been using it for very long, but in the short time I have had it, I have not been disappointed. I used the Disney WOW BD to set it up after a pretty good break in period and the picture quality has been phenomenal. I do not notice any buzz that others have mentioned from the speakers and I sit about eight feet away from mine. It does have a slight buzz, but I can only really hear it if the volume is turned all the down to like 1 or 2 and I really have to be listening for it.I primarily use this TV for movies and video games. I have used it for gaming from the very beginning and I have not had any IR or burn in at all. I noticed that this TV is much better for FPS games than our LCD. The picture is much smoother without the motion blurring from the fast pacing, and the quality is much better with the best blacks that I have seen.Shipping was handled well, I did have to help the delivery guy bring it in the house and set it up, but that was not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: awsome!!!
Reviews.Author: leroy miller
Reviews.Content: After having a DLP 57" for years and watching other friends who owned LED sets I didn't see a lot of difference so was concerned about the logic of upgrading to the plasma. WOW!!! AWSOME!!! Why are people being pushed into the LED sets? All people should look at the plasma and that's not easy when looking at sets in the store. Not many display models out there.

Reviews.Title: Samsung SMART TV
Reviews.Author: LarryK "Larrykga"
Reviews.Content: Samsung was rated #1 by Consumer Reports and also received high ratings by CNET. After ordering, set came within days. Delivery men removed it from box, set up the stand and turned it on. They do not set up with cables. Product has lived up to expectations. Purchased a Logitech wireless keyboard to interact with SMART internet functions. Much better than using the on-screen keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Great picture at a great price
Reviews.Author: Rovelt
Reviews.Content: Had this TV for about 4 months and I'm very happy. All the "pro" reviews will tell you how technically proficient set is so I won't bother with that.  Humming was an issue initially but it went away after a few days. 24p & 3D were two major factors in my wanting to upgrade and this set gives you both.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is an issues with the stand & missing hardware but it I wall mounted it eventually making that a moot point.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV...
Reviews.Author: Edmonson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 2012 TV after trying a few other less expensive 3D LED TVs. One of the things I liked about this TV is that it has the anti-glare screen which works very well to eliminate glare, not unlike a mat screen on a LED TV would, though this TV also has a darker coating which helps to dampen the reflection of bright white objects in front of the TV. This TV also apparently has the same screen and black levels as the more expensive Samsung 8000 series, and with similar black levels to the Panasonic ST50 (2012) plasma models. The black levels look awesome in a dimly lit room, though in an absolutely dark room the black levels don't match the top of the line TVs, like the Panasonic plasma VT60 (2013) and ZT60 (2013) series.The Samsung 6500 3D (active) picture looks very good, and does give a clearer image than the passive 3D technology which is only 720p, or less, since it splits the image, whereas the active 3D image is 1080p. The only real downside with the active glasses is that they are battery operated glasses, though one can also buy rechargeable active glasses. This TV has a ton of settings and comes with a stand that swivels, 2 USB ports, as well as two sets of 3D active glasses. On some less expensive 3D TVs, like the LED LG3400, and LG5850 series, I noticed that they were very limited in their settings when in 3D mode as compared to when watching a DVD or Blu-ray, but on this TV one has a full array of settings from which to adjust the image no matter what format one is watching.This plasma TV also seems very quiet, and I can't hear anything like a buzzing unless I'm right up beside the TV. My blu-ray player actually makes more noise than this TV. This plasma TV is also one of the few plasmas to attain the level of Energy Star which it does when in the Standard mode with the default settings. Overall this is an excellent TV with amazing colour, detail and excellent black levels.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and would definitely buy again.
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: AWESOME TV .  I have had it for almost a year now and have had no issues.  The 3D works great!  This TV replaced our 50" Pioneer TV and we are glad to have made the switch.  It look wonderful mounted over our fireplace and was easy to mount.  The functions all work well and I find it easy to navigate thru.

Reviews.Title: Great except for grey background
Reviews.Author: Robert Cassella
Reviews.Content: Great picture except for when watching hockey, the ice looks grey and not white. I notice this when there is any white background like on some commercials.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Mary S. Gerhardt "Suebug"
Reviews.Content: Love everything about it.  Very satisfied with the TV and the customer service.  Would recommend this TV to anyone who is looking for a quality HD/3D TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: SmartBean
Reviews.Content: I bought this after reading consumer reports recommendations and have no regrets. The picture quality and sound quality are excellent. My TV faces a window that's covered with translucent, but I don't find it a problem with this set. The smart-TV features are very convenient, although I dislike the loud beep the TV makes when navigating menus.

Reviews.Title: fantastic television!
Reviews.Author: pac
Reviews.Content: This is my first big-screen tv, and was hesitant to buy the "used" one from Amazon even though it was about $400 cheaper than new, but went for it.  The tv, which the website said had "cosmetic imperfections" or some such thing, was shipped from the amazon warehouse (apparently not where other things from Amazon are shipped). It arrived on time, the two fellows who brought it were very nice, putting it where it was to go, and basically just turned it on to make sure it turned on.  that's it.  I opted to keep the box "just in case" I had to send it back.  What was missing were the 3-D glasses, but when I called Amazon, they gave me a credit to purchase the missing items!  Voila! The squeeky wheel gets the oil folks.  also, and actually more importantly, there was some hardware missing to screw the base onto the tv.  I had some screws in my basement that did the trick tho, but the base still wasn't really standing firm.  Leaned forward a little.  Regarding the tv itself -- I LOVE hi-def!  There's nothing like watching Dexter and blood spatter in hi-def!  LOL -- but the SMART HUB is pretty much useless.  It's plastered with "programs" but you have to join (i.e. pay money) for them -- like "Fitness" (which would make me think I could click on that and I'd get some exercise programs to enjoy), Movies and TV Shows, or Media Hub, but not the case.  There's a web browser icon, Schedule Manager, Channel, Source, etc. HOWEVER, using the remote that came with the television, you have to use DIRECTIONAL ARROWS and plop out one letter at a time for putting in any user names, passwords, searching!  Absolutely worthless unless you have a wireless keyboard, which does NOT come with the tv, and I've read other review saying that some wi-fi keyboards that samsung directs you to don't even work with this tv anyway!  Since I have cable box and remote, that's the remote I use to do everything.  It does everything easily that the remote doesn't do easily. I never even go to the Smart Hub.  but I gotta say, for the price -- this tv ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Gaijin
Reviews.Content: Great picture, clear audio, sleek case, energy efficient, and at a good price.  What's not to like?  I was so happy with it, I bought a smaller one for my bedroom too.

Reviews.Title: I love this tv. exceeds my expectations.
Reviews.Author: robert daniel
Reviews.Content: 3d movies with the active glasses are sharp and clear. Good picture from all angles. I would recommend this product

Reviews.Title: better tan my old projection screen tv
Reviews.Author: robert glenn
Reviews.Content: better picture in dark room.still learning how to use remote.sound quality is good but use of a sound bar might be an improvement

Reviews.Title: super service!
Reviews.Author: Scott Schermerhorn
Reviews.Content: I had major issues with on-line store in the past - these guys did it right! arrived on time - when they said it would -not damaged and it works great

Reviews.Title: Same quality as much more expensive televisions
Reviews.Author: Darrel D. Tipton
Reviews.Content: Great television.  I have always liked Samsung but was amazed at the quality of 3d, smart tv, etc. for the price of this set.  Superior quality is now available for nominal prices.  Easy hookup as my son and I installed the set.  So far , I have been more than pleased with the Samsung 60 inch.

Reviews.Title: Amazing plasma that easily competes with the ST50
Reviews.Author: NoWorries
Reviews.Content: Ordered this puppy (new) after having issues twice with used P60ST50. The Panasonic plasma's have a darker black level, however  after tweaking the video settings on this Samsung... wow the overall picture quality is better IMHO.I used these settings: [...]It is a very accurate picture and there is a mild buzzing but not enough to notice or to make me crazy. Couldn't be happier with this purchase for only 1400...  Don't hesitate on this purchase. Buy buy buy.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: J. Neeb
Reviews.Content: I have owned this TV for a little over a month and it meets all expectations.  I was afraid of buying a plasma screen because of all the warnings about viewing in bright lighting situations .The picture is great the only time there is glare on the screen is when the sun is shining straight through the window the TV faces, i just close the shades and continue watching.  I have it hooked up to a surround sound system so i can't comment on the sound.  Don't be afraid of plasma.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sheldon M. Garon
Reviews.Content: I love the rich, but subtle, colors.  Some spoke of a hum, but I don't hear it.  It was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture
Reviews.Author: DR D
Reviews.Content: I am happy with this purchase. It has no buzzing. I've had it for over two weeks and have no problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Juan J. Machuca
Reviews.Content: My previous TV was an LCD LG 32'' that is now in my bedroom. Obviously, moving to 60 inches is a huge difference and I can notice a huge difference (good difference.) People freak out about how dark plasmas are, but on it own, this tv looks awesome in my living room. I have heard a slight buzz, but honestly I quickly forget about as soon as the volume is turned up.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Matt Q
Reviews.Content: Great product, I couldn't be happier.  Haven't used 3D function yet. I'm not too concerned though, for the price the 3D feature was basically just to future proof my tv.  As much as possible anyway.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, pretty good 3D, slight buzz
Reviews.Author: Brian Martinez
Reviews.Content: This TV has an incredibly clear picture. The 3D works pretty well though up converting is nothing too special. There is a buzz to the TV but putting the ferrite cores on the power cable seemed to have helped though. It is worth noting that the power cable is only about 4-5' long. So you may want to purchase a longer one (14AWG from monoprice with a right angle end) or just make sure your outlet is close by.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Roy S. Winter
Reviews.Content: Search no further!  No buzz noise or glare!  Glad we decided on this one! HD 3D is great! I still like my Toshiba, it was four years old.. Moved it into the bedroom!

Reviews.Title: Buzzing, and how to know if you'll hear it
Reviews.Author: Chris Prince
Reviews.Content: Although the color was excellent on this plasma TV, the buzzing was too much for me to overlook.  I ended up returning it and getting a similar LED television instead.The sound reminded me of a compact fluorescent bulb in a misadjusted dimmer socket.  Some people don't notice this (or don't have dimmer sockets), but it grates on me whenever I hear it.  If you tend to notice this, you will likely notice the buzz from the 2012 Samsung plasma TVs too.Some people have said that sitting off-center made the problem go away, but this didn't work in my case.

Reviews.Title: Returned Plasma
Reviews.Author: LCSeminole
Reviews.Content: Bought this Samsung because it had the professional black panel.  Expected a "Like New" product to make it to my door in the original box with the manufacturers original foam bracing.  It came in a "Warehouse Deals" box with make-shift foam inserts that weren't made for the plasma.  The panel was cracked upon very close inspection, looking at the correct angle and wasn't visible straight on.  So inspect very thoroughly.  To Amazon's credit, they arranged for the plasma to be picked up and I was credited within 2 days of their receipt.

Reviews.Title: Not the quality and product I expected.
Reviews.Author: Johnnyb
Reviews.Content: There was not consistency between images on different chanels in both picture detail and color quality.  I've tried different calibration settings and have not been able to find a setting that consistenly delivers the picture quality you would expect from a tv in this price range.I am returning this item.

Reviews.Title: E7000...hassle-free delivery, outstanding picture quality
Reviews.Author: kordav
Reviews.Content: I've had the E7000 for about 2 months.  First, the delivery service (via Pilot) was great...delivered when promised, no problems at all.  Second, the E7000 picture quality is unsurpassed (imho).  Finally, unlike some of the other reviewers, I've not experienced the slightest buzzing.  After two months, I am extremely happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Died in three days!
Reviews.Author: ReubenET
Reviews.Content: 1. The buzzing sound many other reviews mention DOES EXIST. It is fairly loud and very annoying.2. My TV died after three days. TV won't turn on, it just has a little red blinking light in the bottom left corner to indicate that, no, it's not the power supply - the TV is really dead.I'll be returning this TV and purchasing the Panasonic TC-PST50 series.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Plasma TV Warning
Reviews.Author: C. Scaffidi "scrappy"
Reviews.Content: I do not write reviews. But I could not restrain myself in this case. After having this TV for 2 years, the screen made a pop sound and cracked while I was watching it. 2 quarter sized cracks in the bottom left. The picture went out and only the sound was working. I have found no recourse since. I've researched and researched, and researched some more and found many who had the same problem, but no one who made any progress with Samsung. The repair costs more than a new TV. This TV was rated at 40,000 hours under regular use conditions. I'd say these TV's are falling a little short. I don't even watch TV that much so I didn't 'over use' it. My frustration level is pretty high.update:Hello, today I spoke with customer service again and was told that because of the "point of impact" the crack on my screen was determined to be "physical damage". How can there be a "point of impact" when nothing impacted or struck the screen? The TV was wall mounted in my bedroom, the only thing ever pointed at it was the remote. I was told I have no recourse even though my research revealed heat expansion cracks are a very common problem for this TV. I am sorry to have to now disregard Samsung products as I am a loyal and long time customer but I cannot just take a 1000$ hit on one of your products. I feel I must replace it with a different manufacturer's product. I am also going to miss this TV as it was one of the best I ever viewed when it was working. It is a shame I could not get a better resolution in this matter...Regretably, Carmen S.

Reviews.Title: 2 bad pixels
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Lesnak
Reviews.Content: I will write a longer review once my issue is resolved.  Powered it up, ran a few test patterns...two bad pixels towards the center of the screen.  I was hoping it was a dirt spec at first, but a closer look showed that one pixel had a "v" shaped black area towards the top and the pixel above it had weak output from one of the color bars.  So now all I see it the dark area caused by this.  Called Samsung and should hear back from them tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: samsung plasma beware!!###
Reviews.Author: luis
Reviews.Content: I am or was a big fan of samsung until i purchased the pn58c8000 which went out due to the famous spider crack which they deemed physical damage until i threatened to take them to court ...fast foward 5 months later new screen now has purple band across top ..their reply its not out problem ...SAMSUNG CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRENDOUS !!! And they will act like they have never heard of you're issues yet thousands of ppl are complaining online about same problems smfh

Reviews.Title: BEWARE: NEVER PURCHASE FROM WAREHOUSE DEALS by AMAZON!!!
Reviews.Author: CorderoD
Reviews.Content: First off, I was never able to actually plug in the TV because the power cord was missing. Additionally, the screws for the stand, the "active" 3D goggles, the user manual, the warranty/safety card, and the cleaning cloth WERE ALL MISSING from this item!!! Furthermore, the packaging was damaged and upon finally taking off the plastic cover over the tv I noticed that there was a huge dent on the back left side of the tv.  Then, I called Amazong "larger purchases" customer service line who offered only to refund the money so I could ship a 60" tv back to them, which I've been waiting weeks for...NO! So eventually the tv was discounted so I could then scavenge to find the parts on my own that were not included in the package.  This was an ok solution but I made this agreement before peeling off the entire packing and realizing the LARGE DENT in the back of the tv.  I'm so disappointed with Amazon. I will never recommend buying  a TV on Amazon...nothing but long waits and headaches...STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware if Your Samsung Plasma Screen Fails
Reviews.Author: Debra K. Corazzelli "OSUDebbie"
Reviews.Content: I have the older model of this TV, the Samsung PN58C6500TF. I bought it in July 2010 and it has fewer than 3000 hours on it. Several weeks ago I noticed bright purple bands across the screen when the picture was white or light. A quick search of the internet showed on several different websites that this is a common problem--hopefully they fixed it on this model. I called Samsung and they referred a local repair company to diagnose the problem ($85), and they said that I will have to replace the panel which comes out to $995 for parts and labor. Is it too much to ask of a "quality" plasma screen TV to last longer than 3000 hours and 2 years, especially when Samsung KNOWS this problem exists??  I've talked to 2 people at Samsung's Executive Customer Relations and they read from their script to inform me that it is not Samsung's responsibility to repair or replace it because the TV is outside of the warranty period.  So THIS is how you treat customers who pay $2000 for a TV with a known defect?  I am not going to put another $995 into this TV, when Samsung should be making their problems right. I guess I'm done with Samsung--the TV  had great reviews and initially had a great picture, but a TV that fails in 24 months from a known problem should be replaced by the manufacturer.  Obviously Samsung doesn't care about its customers.  If you really want Samsung over Panasonic or another top brand, make sure you pay extra for an extended warranty--don't expect anything from Samsung Service once they have your money.
